title.narrative: ACCESS TO PROTECTIVE BASIC EDUCATION

description.narrative: Children and young people in humanitarian situations have access to protective, quality basic education services, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and young people in humanitarian situations have access to protective, quality basic education services

description.narrative: With UNICEF’s support, a total of 948,428 children in humanitarian situations (435,121 girls) accessed protective quality education services, representing 86 per cent of the target for 2021. UNICEF successfully advocated with the government to reopen schools after 14 months of closure, and supported continuity of learning with a one-off payment of incentives to 34,881 teachers (28% female) for the first academic term. UNICEF constructed and/or rehabilitated 21 schools in 2021 and 713 cumulatively and equipped them with disability friendly gender-disaggregated WASH facilities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
